plan: In the initial rounds, I will test aggressive bidding strategies by bidding slightly above my perceived value to gather data on Betty's bidding behavior. Midway, I'll switch to conservative bids, slightly below my perceived value, to evaluate profit margins. In later rounds, I'll apply a mixed strategy, adjusting bids based on observed patterns in Betty's behavior and my perceived value. I'll also occasionally place random bids to prevent predictability. Throughout, I'll monitor Betty's bids to refine my strategy, aiming to maximize profit by balancing winning frequency and minimizing overpayment.

In the first few rounds, I'll experiment with a range of bids around my perceived value, sometimes bidding slightly above and sometimes below, to gather data on Andy's bidding patterns. I'll also occasionally place aggressive bids above my perceived value to test Andy's response and willingness to bid high. As rounds progress, I'll analyze the data to identify any patterns in Andy's bidding strategy, adjusting my bids to maximize profit by either undercutting Andy's typical bids or strategically outbidding him when the perceived value minus the second-highest bid ensures a positive profit.

In the next rounds, bid slightly above perceived value to test Betty's aggression. Midway, switch to bids slightly below perceived value to evaluate profit margins. In later rounds, mix strategies based on observed patterns, occasionally placing random bids to prevent predictability and maximize long-term profit.

Experiment with bids 5-10% above and below perceived value to gauge Andy's response. Prioritize profit by undercutting or slightly outbidding Andy based on patterns. Adjust bids to ensure positive profit margins, focusing on rounds with higher perceived values for more aggressive bids.

In round 2, bid slightly above perceived value to further test Betty's aggression. Observe her responses to adjust future bids. Midway, switch to conservative strategies. In later rounds, mix strategies and introduce random bids to maximize profit and prevent predictability, refining based on Betty's behavior.

Test bids slightly below perceived value to identify Andy's lower limit. Increase bids in high-value rounds to secure wins. Analyze Andy's bid patterns, adjusting to maximize profit while minimizing overbidding. Prioritize rounds with perceived value near common value, ensuring positive profit margins.

In round 3, bid slightly below perceived value to test Betty's willingness to overbid. Observe her response. In rounds 4-5, mix bids around perceived value to refine understanding of her strategy. Later, introduce random bids to prevent predictability and maximize long-term profit, adjusting based on observed patterns.

Test bids 10% above perceived value in high-value rounds; bid 5% below in low-value rounds. Focus on identifying Andy's bid patterns, adjusting to consistently undercut or outbid him. Prioritize maximizing profit by balancing aggressive and conservative strategies based on perceived versus common value insights.

In rounds 4-5, bid slightly above perceived value to increase chances of winning. Observe Betty's responses to refine strategy. In later rounds, introduce random bids to prevent predictability and maximize profit. Adjust based on Betty's patterns, focusing on balancing winning frequency and minimizing overpayment.

Analyze Andy's bids for patterns; bid 5% above perceived value in high-value rounds, 5% below in low-value rounds. Adjust to undercut or outbid Andy strategically. Focus on maximizing profit by balancing aggressive and conservative bids, ensuring positive profit margins while gathering data on Andy's bidding behavior.

In rounds 5-6, bid slightly below perceived value to test Betty's consistency. In rounds 7-8, introduce random bids around perceived value to disrupt patterns. For rounds 9-10, analyze Betty's responses and adjust bids strategically to maximize profit, balancing risk and reward.

Test bids slightly below perceived value in low-value rounds and slightly above in high-value rounds. Focus on identifying Andy's bid patterns to strategically undercut or outbid him. Prioritize maximizing profit by balancing aggressive and conservative strategies, ensuring bids align closely with perceived value for optimal outcomes.

In rounds 6-7, bid at perceived value to gather data on Betty's consistency. In rounds 8-9, introduce random bids below perceived value to test her risk tolerance. In round 10, strategically adjust based on observed patterns, aiming to maximize profit by balancing winning chances and minimizing overpayment.

Analyze Andy's bids to identify patterns. Bid 2-5% above perceived value in high-value rounds to secure wins. In low-value rounds, bid slightly below perceived value to minimize losses. Adjust bids based on Andy's patterns, focusing on maximizing profit while managing risk effectively.

In rounds 7-8, bid slightly below perceived value to test Betty's consistency. In round 9, introduce a random bid to disrupt patterns. For round 10, strategically adjust based on observed responses, aiming to maximize profit by balancing winning chances and minimizing overpayment.

Analyze Andy's bid patterns; bid 2-5% above perceived value in high-value rounds, slightly below in low-value rounds. Test strategic undercutting when Andy overbids. Prioritize maximizing profit by balancing aggressive and conservative bids, focusing on perceived value alignment for optimal outcomes. Adjust based on observed bidding behaviors.

In round 8, bid slightly below perceived value to test Betty's consistency. In round 9, introduce a random bid to disrupt her pattern. For round 10, strategically analyze Betty's responses, aiming to balance winning chances and minimize overpayment to maximize profit. Adjust based on observed behaviors.

Analyze Andy's bid patterns; bid 3-5% above perceived value in high-value rounds, slightly below in low-value rounds. Test strategic undercutting when Andy overbids. Focus on maximizing profit by aligning bids with perceived value and Andy's patterns, adjusting based on observed behaviors to optimize outcomes.

In round 9, place a random bid slightly below perceived value to disrupt Betty's pattern. For round 10, analyze Betty's past bids and strategically adjust to balance winning chances and minimize overpayment, aiming to maximize profit by leveraging observed bidding behaviors.

Analyze Andy's pattern; bid 1-3% above perceived value in high-value rounds, slightly below in low-value rounds. Focus on strategic undercutting when Andy overbids. Prioritize maximizing profit by aligning bids with perceived value and observed patterns, optimizing outcomes while managing risk effectively. Adjust based on Andy's responses.
